metadata.title: CVE-2017-9471 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In ytnef 1.9.2, the SwapWord function in lib/ytnef.c allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read andapplication crash) via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9471` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libytnef0 - 1.9.3-1
ytnef-tools - 1.9.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libytnef package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-1').
